article: David, my neighbor, has two young kids who are five and seven. One day he was  teaching  his seven-year-old son Kelly how to push the lawn mower around the yard. As he was telling him how to turn the mower  _  , his wife, Jan, called to him to ask a question. As David answered the question, Kelly pushed the lawn mower  _  through the flower bed at the edge of the lawn --  _  When David turned back and saw what had happened, he began to lose  _  . David had put a lot of time and  _  into making those flower beds the  _  of the neighbourhood. As he began to  _  his voice to his son, Jan walked quickly over to him, put her hand on his shoulder and said, "David, please remember we are raising children, not  _  !" Jan  _  me how important  _  is as a parent to remember our priorities (things that need attention before others). The window shattered by a  _  , a lamp knocked over by a careless child, or a plate dropped in the kitchen are already  _  . The flowers are already dead. We must remember not to  _  to the destruction by breaking a child's spirit and deadening his  _  . A few weeks ago Mark Michaels, the owner of a store, and I were together  _  parenting. He told me while his family were out for dinner, his daughter knocked over her water glass.  _  the water was cleaned up without any blaming remarks from her parents, she looked up and said, "I  _  want to thank you for not being like other parents. Most of my friends' parents  _  have shouted at them and given them a lecture about paying more attention. Thanks for not  _  that!"
